title: Vegetarian Bean Enchiladas
description: Veggie heavy eenchiladas with pleenty of cheese to go around. This is not a vegan recipe, but it can be altered to fit your needs.
story: I am not vegan or vegetarian, but that does not mean that I can't enjoy meatless meals every now and then. This is one of my favorite non meat dishes. It is always fun to have for lunch leftovers as well.

ingredients.2: 1 can (20 oz each) Enchilada Sauce, divided
ingredients.3: 1 can (16 oz each) Vegetarian Refried Beans
ingredients.4: 1 can (10 oz each) Diced Tomatoes & Green Chiles - No Salt Added, drained
ingredients.5: 1 pkg (10 oz each) Chopped Spinach, thawed and squeezed dry, or chopped fresh spinach
ingredients.7: 1 cups shredded Mexican blend cheese, divided
ingredients.9: 1 small can of black sliced olives, drained

directions.1: Preheat the oven to 375Â°F. Spray 13x9-inch glass baking dish with cooking spray. Spread 1 cup sauce over bottom of baking dish; set aside. Stir together 1/4 cup more sauce, beans, drained tomatoes, spinach, corn, and 1/2 cup cheese in medium bowl.
directions.2: Top each tortilla with 1/3 cup bean mixture. Roll up and place seam side down in baking dish. Spoon remaining sauce over top of enchiladas; sprinkle with remaining 1 cup of cheese and spread olives on top.
directions.3: Cover dish with aluminum foil; bake 30 minutes or until enchiladas are hot and cheese melts

tips: I like to add about 1/2 cup of queso fresco and/or 1/2 cup of sliced mushrooms in the bean mixture. Feel free to add or exchange some ingredients for whatever you have available.
